articles.title: New Year's Card from Hu Jintao
articles.content:
New Year's Card from Hu Jintao
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a New Year's card from Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 99 (2010.)
					 The card was handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, on Monday.

articles.title: Gift from Jiang Zemin
articles.content:
Gift from Jiang Zemin
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Jiang Zemin, former general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 99 (2010.)
					 It was handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, on Monday.

articles.title: Anniversary of Assumption of Supreme Commander Celebrated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Assumption of Supreme Commander Celebrated
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A meeting of youth and students was held at the Central Youth Hall and that of agricultural workers at the Chilgol Farm in Mangyongdae District on Dec. 21 on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 Present there were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea and youth and students and agricultural workers.
					
					 The reporters and speakers said that Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the revolutionary armed forces made it possible to steadily advance the Juche-oriented cause of army building started by President Kim Il Sung and invariably carry forward the tradition of the Korean revolution which emerged victorious thanks to Songun.
					
					 Kim Jong Il built the People's Army into vanguard ranks devotedly defending the leader and a matchless and invincible revolutionary army with his outstanding ideas and theories and distinguished military wisdom and ever-victorious commanding art, thus putting the Juche-oriented cause of army building on new higher stage, they noted, adding:
					
					 The dignity and spirit of Juche Korea were demonstrated to the world and spectacular successes have been made in the drive for building a great prosperous and powerful nation against the backdrop of a new great surge under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They stressed the need to perform honorable feats in the great drive for building a thriving nation and thus make substantial contributions to accomplishing the Songun revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Military Attaches Corps Visits Korean Revolution Museum
articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Visits Korean Revolution Museum
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here Tuesday visited the Korean Revolution Museum on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					 Members of the corps looked round photos and historic materials with keen interest, being briefed on the fact that Kim Jong Il has wisely led the drive of the army and people of the DPRK to build a thriving nation while defending socialism with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Aleksei Bartusov, military attache of the Russian embassy, made an entry in the visitor's book. He wrote that the visit to the museum provided an opportunity to know well about the dynamic struggle of the army and people of the DPRK united close around Kim Jong Il to build a socialist thriving nation, overcoming difficulties.
					
					 He expressed hope that the KPA and the Korean people would achieve fresh success in socialist construction.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Zhang Weihua's Family
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Zhang Weihua's Family
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by the family of Zhang Weihua, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, Tuesday on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 92nd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.

articles.title: Congratulations from Foreign Diplomats
articles.content:
Congratulations from Foreign Diplomats
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					 On behalf of the corps Aleksei Bartusov, military attache of the Russian embassy, handed the basket and letter over to an official concerned on Tuesday.
					
					 On the same day the economic and commercial councilors corps here presented a congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Il on the above-said occasion and the 92nd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine. The letter was conveyed to an official concerned by Wang Zhilin, economic and commercial councilor of the Chinese embassy who is doyen of the corps.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Birthday Observed
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Birthday Observed
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors corps here Tuesday laid bouquets before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine, at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on the occasion of her 92nd birth anniversary.
					 After placing bunches of flowers, the members of the corps paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu who set a noble example of devotedly defending the leader and devoted her all to the liberation of the country and happiness of the people, true to the leadership of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Representatives and staff members of foreign embassies here visited the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill Tuesday on the occasions of the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 92nd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					 The visitors went round production processes of the mill with keen interest, being told about the fact that its workers have been making innovative achievements in production.
					
					 At the end of the visit, they made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Arranges Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Arranges Reception
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at his embassy on Monday on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 99 (2010.) 
					 Present there on invitation were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, Pak Kyong Son, Sin Yong Hun and others and officials concerned.
					
					 On hand were staff member of the embassy.
					
					 Liu Xiaoming said in his speech at the reception that China and the DPRK have boosted the mutually beneficial cooperation through colorful events this year, the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries, developing the Sino-DPRK friendly relations on a higher level.
					
					 Noting that the Korean people will greet the 65th birthday of the WPK next year, he wished them greater success under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He stressed that the Chinese people would strive hard shoulder to shoulder with the Korean comrades to boost the relations between the two parties and countries.
					
					 Choe Thae Bok said in his speech that 2009 would be remembered by the peoples of the two countries as an unforgettable year.
					
					 He expressed the hope that under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Hu Jintao as General Secretary the fraternal people of China would register fresher successes in their endeavors for building a harmonious socialist society based on the scientific outlook on development and implementing the decisions of the 4th plenary meeting of the 17th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 He expressed belief that the exchanges and cooperation between the two parties and peoples would grow stronger through the concerted efforts of both sides in the new year.

articles.title: Cambodian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Cambodian Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Chhorn Hay, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at his embassy on Dec. 21 on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Cambodia.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as vice-chairman of the DPRK-Cambodia Friendship Association, and officials concerned. 
					
					 On hand were staff members of the Cambodian embassy.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Swiss Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Swiss Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Blaise Godet, Swiss ambassador to the DPRK, arranged a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Monday on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and the Swiss Confederation.
					 Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairwoman of the DPRK-Switzerland Friendship Association, Kim Yong Suk, vice-minister of Agriculture, and officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 On hand were Katharina Zellweger, country director of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation in the DPRK, and staff members of the Swiss embassy.
					
					 Blaise Godet said at the reception that the Swiss Confederation and the DPRK have boosted the multilateral exchanges and cooperation in various fields since the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries. He expressed hope that the exchanges and cooperation between the two countries would go on in the future, too.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun said in his speech that the DPRK and Switzerland have promoted confidence and developed the bilateral relations in various fields over the past 35 years since the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries, expressing belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would grow stronger.

articles.title: Preview of "Song of East Sea"
articles.content:
Preview of "Song of East Sea"
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A feature film "Song of East Sea" (Parts 1 and 2) was recently produced by the Korean Film Studio. The preview of the film took place at Taedongmun Cinema on Tuesday.
					 Appreciating the film were senior party and state officials, the chairpersons of the friendly parties, officials of ministries and national institutions and working people in Pyongyang. 
					
					 The film makes an artistic depiction of the historical fact that a new era of the Juche-oriented overseas compatriots movement was ushered in and the desire of Koreans in Japan for their repatriation to the socialist homeland came true thanks to the outstanding idea and wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Koreans in Japan including hero of the film Han Tok Su, though subjected to all sorts of national contempt and discrimination in Japan, are dynamically advancing along the road of patriotism, holding the President in high esteem as the sun of the nation as he achieved the liberation of the country and built a genuine country for the people.
					
					 Highly proud of being overseas citizens of the dignified DPRK, they declare the birth of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, a Juche-typed overseas compatriots' organization, before the whole world, frustrating the reckless moves of the U.S. and Japanese reactionaries, and enforce the national education in the alien land, firmly carrying forward the tradition of Juche, that of patriotism.
					
					 The first repatriation ship leaves for the motherland, sounding a whistle to the great excitement of the Koreans in Japan thanks to the compatriotic love of the peerlessly great man. 
					
					 Watching the film with deep emotion, the audience keenly realize that the socialist homeland built by the President and glorified by General Secretary Kim Jong Il is the cradle of a genuine life and happiness of all Koreans.

articles.title: Monument to Imjin War Heroes Exhibited
articles.content:
Monument to Imjin War Heroes Exhibited
Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A historic monument has newly been placed on show in the Hamhung History Museum.
					The 2.8-ton monument, which had been erected in front of the Changui Temple in 1721 in memory of 12 volunteer army commanders who distinguished themselves in the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598) against Japanese invaders, is one of the valuable historic relics in Korea.
					
					The monument has an inscription saying the Changui Temple is a place dedicated to memorial services for those who devoted their lives to the country during the Imjin Patriotic War. As history shows, it is a very difficult thing to remain faithful to principles and duty but praiseworthily, the twelve fought for justice at the cost of their lives to be still remembered, it says, adding: We, with deep reverence for them, erect a monument in front of the temple and engrave three big letters "Chang-ui-sa (Changui Temple)" on it.

articles.title: Year Filled with Miraculous Events
articles.content:
Year Filled with Miraculous Events
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- After the torch of a new revolutionary upsurge was kindled at the Chollima Steel Complex, home to the Chollima (legendary winged horse galloping 400 km a day) movement, in December last year, a lot of stirring events have been recorded in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea this year.
					 The Wonsan Youth Power Station was put into operation at the beginning of the year to make the Wonsan citizens fully benefit from electricity in their houses, while increasing the country's generating capacity. Factories, buildings and streets of Manpho City, Jagang Province have facelifted themselves to turn the city into a socialist fairyland.
					
					 Scientists and technicians succeeded in launching carrier rocket Unha-2 to send artificial satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 into orbit according to the long-range plan of the state for space development.
					
					 The Samilpho Specialties Factory, furnished with modern processing and packing equipment, has produced many varieties of foodstuffs with local materials.
					
					 Grand evening galas of firecrackers "Fireworks for Great, Prosperous and Powerful Nation", "We Will Emerge Victorious!" and "We Will Go Confidently Following the Great Party!" were held to commemorate the 97th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, May Day and the 64th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea respectively.
					
					 The Nyongwon Power Station was built as a monumental edifice of the Songun era and a magnesia clinker production system established on the basis of domestic resources and technology.
					
					 Included in this year's tremendous achievements are the success in sturgeon breeding in Sinchang and the reclaimed tideland on Taegye Islet in North Phyongan Province, a nature-remaking project as gigantic as the West Sea Barrage.
					
					The completion of the long-extending Miru Plain waterway project with a gravity-fed irrigation system has made it possible to water some 20,000 hectares of fields in Koksan and Singye areas through its arteries and branches without use of electricity and pumping facilities.
					
					 Remarkable achievements have been reported from leading industrial establishments such as the Chollima Steel Complex, Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, Musan Mining Complex, Ryongsong Machine Complex, Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, Taean Heavy Machine Complex, Anju Area Coal Complex, Jaeryong Mine, Unryul Mine, Namhung Youth Chemical Complex and Rakwon Machine Complex. The production has been revitalized in light industry and agriculture, too. 
					
					Ultramodern computer-numerical-controlled machine tools made by Korean technicians and workers themselves have helped update factories producing motorcars, tractors, electric locomotives and excavators. Based on ultramodern science, the country's defence power has been further enhanced to reliably defend the socialist system.
					
					 Apartment buildings have appeared in Mansudae Street on the bank of the River Pothong in Pyongyang as a model of housing construction.
					
					 The DPRK football team earned a ticket for the 2010 FIFA World Cup to create a great sensation again after 44 years.
					
					 The plan of the 150-day campaign was carried out at 112 percent, taking the country as a whole, with the industrial production showing a 1.2-fold increase over the same period of last year and hundreds of units commissioned or updated.
					
					 In the first fifty days of the ongoing 100-day campaign, the industrial output of the country was increased 1.3 times that in the same period of last year and many projects completed.
					
					A new speed has been created in the construction of the Huichon Power Station, Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station and 100,000 flats in Pyongyang, the gasification project of the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex and other major projects.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts US Military Hysteria
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts US Military Hysteria
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The 51st combat flying corps of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea together with the 20th combat flying corps of the south Korean army staged a joint aerial drill aimed at invading the DPRK at the U.S. air force base in Osan, south Korea, from Dec. 16 to 18. Prior to it, there were U.S.-south Korea joint aerial assault exercises in Kangwon and Kyonggi provinces of south Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The military exercises staged by the U.S. warmongers to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK at the end of the year show that the U.S. has not the slightest intention of making a switchover in its policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. war-like forces have staged the madcap war racket against the DPRK, ceaselessly reinforcing and deploying their task forces including nuclear carrier in south Korea and its vicinity, with the hostility toward the DPRK.
					
					 The consecutive joint exercises staged by the U.S. imperialists with the south Korean army this month revealed their true colors as war maniacs and criminal attempt to realize the design for invasion of the DPRK by force of arms at any cost.
					
					 Their military hysteria proves that the U.S. schemes to stifle the DPRK by force, giving priority to the war method. In other words, the U.S. has no will to make a switchover in its hostile policy towards the DPRK but is only seeking a war against it.
					
					 The U.S. bellicose forces would be well advised to abandon their reckless war hysteria, clearly understanding who their rival is.

articles.title: Japan's Human Rights Abuses under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Human Rights Abuses under Fire
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- These days Japan is going so foolish and ridiculous as to peddle the fictitious "human rights issue" of the DPRK in the international arena in a bid to internationalize it and tarnish its image. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed article in this regard:
					
					The anti-DPRK "human rights" ruckus kicked up by Japan only strips bare its crafty aim to keep the human rights abuses perpetrated by it in the past buried into oblivion forever and divert elsewhere the attention of the world.
					
					 By nature Japan is not qualified to talk about human rights issues in any place of world, being ill-famed for its human rights abuses.
					
					 When looking back on history, Japan has committed indelible crimes against the Koreans and other Asians. The monstrous human rights abuses committed by the Japanese imperialists during their occupation of Korea are recorded in history as stark facts.
					
					During their more than 40 year-long colonial rule over Korea after illegally occupying it by force of arms in the first half of the 20th century the Japanese imperialists forcibly drafted and kidnapped at least 8.4 million young and middle-aged Koreans either to use them as cannon fodder in the shambles of war or force them to do slave labor. They, at the same time, took away 200,000 Korean women, reducing them to "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					Many of those Koreans were killed by them. Not content with these atrocities, they committed such unheard-of crimes as depriving Koreans of their own names and spoken and written languages.
					
					 Japan, however, is brazen-facedly denying its crimes and distorting its crime-woven history, far from honestly reflecting on its past crimes and settling them. These behaviors are an intolerable insult and a mockery of the Korean people as they only add to its crimes.
					
					 The statute of limitation is not applicable to the human rights abuses. Japan should, therefore, stop evading its responsibility for its past hideous human rights abuses and redeem them as soon as possible.

articles.title: Japan's Moves to Become Military Giant under
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Become Military Giant under Fire
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Japan was recently reported to have put into orbit a new type spy satellite whose resolution is increased to 60cm by home-made prototype rocket H-2A and launch more spy satellites by 2012.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 This indicates that Japan regards the intensified espionage through satellites as an important link in the chain efforts for turning itself into a military power.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 What matters is that the sky over the Korean Peninsula is used by Japan as the theatre of its espionage.
					
					 By taking an active part in the intelligence-gathering operations through satellites in the sky over the Korean Peninsula Japan seeks to secure a pretext for turning itself into a military giant and acquire capability for standing on a par with the powers in the military field.
					
					 It is apt to cite "missile threat from north Korea" as a pretext for justifying its wrong doings.
					
					 Japan's loudmouthed "missile threat" from the DPRK to it is nothing but a lie told by the former to achieve its sinister aim.
					
					 Japan has focused its efforts on beefing up its military muscle not to cope with someone's threat but to threaten others by force of arms and invade them.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to drop its bad habit of pulling up others to draw water to its mill and stop at once its reckless moves to become a military giant.
					
					 These moves will bring Japan nothing but self-destruction.

articles.title: Rigmarole Made by Hyon In Thaek Slammed
articles.content:
Rigmarole Made by Hyon In Thaek Slammed
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Hyon In Thaek, south Korean minister of "Unification", addressing a recent joint meeting of permanent members of the "Advisory Council for Democracy and Peaceful Unification," talked nonsense that this year was "a year in which the principle of the inter-Korean relations was made clear and it was put into a concrete practice" and "a cornerstone was laid for proper inter-Korean relations".
					  Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 Hyon's loudmouthed "principle" and "cornerstone" are nothing but a revelation of his anti-reunification and confrontational conception of disregarding the inter-Korean joint declarations and escalating confrontation with compatriots and an unpardonable rigmarole insulting and making mockery of the fellow countrymen who anxiously aspire after national reunification.
					
					He has self-praised, claiming that he has done something since he took office. This was, in essence, an entreaty not to fire him as he proposed defining "no nukes, opening and 3,000 dollars" as a "principle of the policy towards the north" this year and has put it into practice and insisted that the "north's dismantlement of its nuclear weapons" is a "cornerstone of the inter-Korean relations."
					
					 It is impossible to expect the improved north-south relations and the reunification of Korea as long as such guy hell-bent on confrontation with fellow countrymen is allowed to remain in office.
					
					 It is shame on the south Korean people that the post of the minister of "Unification" is held by such bete noire who only twists the reality, ignorant of the principle and cornerstone already provided through the process for settling the inter-Korean relations and the issue of reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe carta de Ano Nuevo de Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe carta de Ano Nuevo de Hu Jintao 
 Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio una carta de felicitacion que le dirigiera Hu Jintao, secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, en ocasion del Ano Nuevo del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche.
					 El embajador chino en Corea, Liu Xiaoming, la entrego el dia 21 al secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Thae Bok.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de Jiang Zemin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de Jiang Zemin
 Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presente de Jiang Zemin, ex secretario general del CC del Partido Comunista de China, en ocasion del Ano Nuevo del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche.
					 El embajador chino en Corea, Liu Xiaoming, lo entrego el dia 21 al secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Choe Thae Bok.

articles.title: Extranjeros depositan ramos de flores ante busto de Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Extranjeros depositan ramos de flores ante busto de Kim Jong Suk
  Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 92o aniversario del natalicio de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk, el Cuerpo de Consejeros Economicos y Comerciales en Corea deposito el dia 22 los ramos de flores ante su busto en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios del monte Taesong.
					  Los huespedes extranjeros guardaron un momento de silencio tras colocar los ramos de flores ante el busto de Kim Jong Suk, Generala del monte Paektu quien creo el sublime ejemplo de defender a costa de la vida al lider y dedico todo lo suyo para la liberacion del pais y la felicidad del pueblo en pleno acato a la direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Preestreno de la pelicula "Cancion del Mar Este" (dos partes)
articles.content:
Preestreno de la pelicula "Cancion del Mar Este" (dos partes)
Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 22 en el Cine Taedongmun el preestreno de la pelicula de ficcion "Cancion del Mar Este" (1-2 partes) filmada recientemente por los Estudios Cinematograficos de Corea.
					 La vieron los cuadros del partido y el Estado, los presidentes de partidos amigos, los funcionarios de los ministerios y organos centrales, asi como los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					 La pelicula demuestra en cuadro artistico los hechos historicos de que gracias a la destacada idea y sabia direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung se abrio la nueva epoca del movimiento autoctono de coreanos en ultramar y se realizo el deseo de los coreanos residentes en Japon para regresar a la patria socialista.
					
					 El protagonista Han Tok Su y otros coreanos residentes en Japon, quienes vivian sufriendo toda clase de desprecios y discriminaciones nacionales en la tierra japonesa, libran energicamente la lucha patriotica enalteciendo como Sol de la nacion al Presidente quien logro la liberacion de la patria y levanto el verdadero pais del pueblo.
					
					  Con gran orgullo de ciudadanos ultramarinos de la digna Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, ellos proclaman a todo el mundo el nacimiento de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos en Japon), organizacion de los coreanos residentes en ultramar de tipo jucheano, frustrando las perversas maniobras de los reaccionarios norteamericanos y japoneses y llevan adelante firmemente la tradicion del Juche, la del patriotismo, practicando la educacion nacional en la  tierra foranea.
					
					  Gracias al amor a la nacion del gran hombre simpar, el primer barco con los coreanos, que regresan a la patria madre, parte hacia la RPDC sonando altamente la sirena en medio de gran emocion de los coreanos residentes en Japon.
					
					  A traves de las escenas emocionantes de la pelicula, los espectadores se sintieron mas profundamente de que la patria socialista, establecida por el Presidente y glorificada por el Dirigente es precisamente la cuna de la verdadera vida y felicidad de toda la nacion.

articles.title: Minju Joson repudia lanzamiento de satelites espias de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson repudia lanzamiento de satelites espias de Japon
Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Japon lanzo recientemente el nuevo satelite espia con la resolucion mejorada a 60cm a bordo del cohete principal de fabricacion nacional "H-2A" y se propone disparar otros mas hasta 2012.  
					 Esto demuestra que Japon considera el fortalecimiento de espionaje satelital como importante eslabon de sus maniobras para convertirse en una potencia militar.
					
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 22 y continua:
					
					El problema reside en que el escenario de operacion de ese aparato es precisamente el cielo sobre la Peninsula Coreana.  
					
					 Al tomar parte activa en el espionaje satelital sobre la Peninsula Coreana, Japon trata de buscar el pretexto de su conversion en la potencia militar y adquirir la capacidad con que pueda competir con las potencias en el area militar.
					
					 Japon justifica su injusta conducta pretextando "hacer frente a la amenaza de misiles del Norte de Corea".
					
					  Esta mentira fue inventada por el mismo para alcanzar sus siniestros objetivos.
					
					  Realmente, el pais isleno se esfuerza mucho por construir las fuerzas armadas belicas no para hacer frente a la amenaza de alguien, sino para amenazar y agredir militarmente a otros.
					
					 El debe dejar su vicio de sacar sus provechos acusando a otros y desistir de inmediato de sus imprudentes maniobras para erigirse como una potencia militar.
					
					 Si sigue portandose de esa manera, no tendra otro resultado que el arruinamiento de si mismo.
